title: Firefox freezes in family tree window in Ancestry.com
content:
I have been running "Ancestry.com" on Firefox" for a number of years without any issues. The last few weeks if I open Ancestry to a window that shows a family tree the window freezes and I get a notice that says "This window is slowing down your browser" and it gives me a button with a "Stop" option. When I click the button the window unfreezes for one click and freezes again. This only happens in a "tree" window, the rest of the application works OK. I have done many of the troubleshooting steps, renew refresh, clear cache etc. with no improvement. I checked with "Ancestry" the recommend Firefox or Chrome. Trying Chrome there was no problem. My preference is Firefox as Chrome is to invasive.

I am running Windows 10 (up to date), an Asus Z87 Plus motherboard, an intel core i7-4770K cpu and a EVGA GTX 650 Ti Boost gpu with all drivers up to date. I have Firefox set as my default browser.

Please advise - Thank You John H ( jrhop@hvc.rr.com)
creator: jrhop63

title: Opentable site returns blank page
content:
Hello,

I have been working with OpenTable support for 2 months. We finally resolved it is not on their end.

Issue: When opening opentable.com the website loads and then a blank page is presented at the end. You can see a flash of the base site and any links that were attempted.

Items attempted to resolve:

  • clear cache and history
  • updated firefox site
  • downloaded, uninstalled and reinstalled firefox
  • incognito mode
  • removed all all ons/plug ins
  • tried links to pages outside of opentable.com

I have their responses and what they have attempted (in emails should you want). I also have snapshots of what I see. The odd thing is completely removing firefox and installing should have fixed it but it didn't.

One thing that does work is links to opentable from restaurants (email or from their websites). Initiating from the base browser does not work.

I am on Windows 10 and all updates have been installed.
creator: pmcgarry1

title: Firefox tarayıcı piksel kaydırma sorunu
content:
Merhaba, İki adet aynı marka ve özelliklerde monitör kullanıyorum. Ekran çözünürlük ayarları 1920x1080 piksel. Tarayıcıyı ikinci monitörde açıyorum ve "xulstore.json" da ayarlarım bu şekilde "screenX:1920,screenY:0,width:1300,height:1080,sizemode:normal" olduğundan ikinci monitörün sıfır pikselinde açıyor. Buraya kadar bir sorun yok.

Fakat son kapatılan sekmeler ayarını (user_pref("browser.sessionstore.max_tabs_undo", 25)) "prefs.js" dosyasında "user_pref("browser.sessionstore.max_tabs_undo", 0)" yaptığım zaman, ikinci mönitörün sıfır pikselinde açmıyor ve 5 piksel sağa kayıyor. Yani sanki "xulstore.json" da 1925 px ayarlanmış gibi oluyor. Fakat "xulstore.json" dosyasına baktığımda ise yaptığım ayar (screenX:1920) duruyor.

Bu sorunun "son kapatılan sekmeler ayarını" sıfır yapınca kaymasını önlemenin bir yolu var mı? Geri bildirimde bulunur iseniz memnun olurum. İyi çalışmalar.

Muharrem.
creator: Tolga

title: Content Security Policy works fine on Chrome and Edge but gives error in Firefox
content:
Hello,

We are currently facing an issue with our website: https://ebanking.denizbank.at/BAC/BecomeACustomer.aspx?lang=de We utilize Google Analytics in this project and have included all the necessary URLs in the Content Security Policy tag. Everything is functioning perfectly on Chrome and Edge, but we encounter an error on Firefox (as shown in the attached screenshot). We have already added the URL that is causing the error on Firefox, and interestingly, Firefox is the only browser where this problem persists.

Could you please assist us in resolving this issue?

Thank you, Okay

content:

I've these prefs: browser.sessionstore.warnOnQuit true browser.tabs.warnOnClose true browser.tabs.warnOnCloseOtherTabs true browser.tabs.warnOnOpen true browser.warnOnQuit true

title: Certificate Prompt Issue in Firefox: Continual Requests Despite Selecting 'Remember this Decision'
content:
I'm having an issue with Firefox where it doesn't remember my certificate choice when trying to access my company's RavenDB host. Each time I navigate to the site, it asks me to select the certificate again, even though I have chosen it literal seconds ago and ticked the Remember this Decision checkbox. When I navigate to the certificates settings and look in the 'Authentication Decisions' tab both the 'certificate name' and 'certificate number' for the host appear as (unavailable). This issue seems to be specific to Firefox, as I don't encounter this problem when using Microsoft Edge. Has anyone experience this before?

I am on a MacBook M2 Pro.

I have tried to open the session in an incognito tab, in case Firefox was trying to use another certificate.

Furthermore I have made sure that the certificate is not the issue since it works in Edge.
creator: christoffer_rm

title: Repeated messages that I use an old version despite having downloaded the most recent version
content:
Hi!

I get repeated messages that I use an old version despite having downloaded the most recent version. When i try to start Firefox it won't start, I only get a message and the precise wording of the message is" You've launched an older version of Firefox Using an older version of Firefox can corrupt bookmarks and browsing history already saved to an existing Firefox profile. To protect your information, create a new profile for this installation of Firefox." Then I get two choices, either "Exit" or "Create New Profile". If I choose the first, I exit. If I choose the latter and create a new profile then I loose my bookmarks and browsing history. Appreciate any solution you might have
creator: nilsson.ja

title: Firefox no puede instalar archivos porque todos "Fallan" sin importar cuanto reintente la descarga
content:
Todos los archivos fallan y no importa cuanto reintente la descarga, se vuelven a fallar y puede que el problema sea mi ordenador o Firefox. El único archivo que pude instalar con este problema fue 1 imagen de un peso inferior a 1 MB. Las paginas como Scratch no permiten cargar proyectos que contengan archivos de audio pesados, aunque en otras paginas no tuve problemas por no poder instalar nada.

Información adicional: Mi ordenador es antiguo, siendo su sistema operativo Windows 7 SP1. A la vez que este problema de instalar archivos en Firefox empezó, mi sistema operativo también empezó a tener errores como que el Reproductor de Windows Media no funciona y termina con APPCRASH, Visualizador de fotos de Windows no puede abrir ninguna imagen y todas las aplicaciones de Pixel-Art como Piskel o el mismo MS Paint no pueden guardar (Y Piskel directamente no abre). No voy a reportar el problema solo con Firefox y buscare ayuda en lugares que sean de Windows, pero es una de las aplicaciones con las que me ocurre todo este dilema.
creator: ninjaoscuro123456
